message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest carpal tunnel syndrome, which is often caused by repetitive motions like typing. Splinting can help relieve symptoms by restricting wrist movement and reducing pressure on the median nerve. Other options like gabapentin or local steroid injections may be considered if splinting alone is not effective, and carpal tunnel release surgery is usually reserved for more severe cases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms are suggestive of carpal tunnel syndrome. Splinting can help alleviate the symptoms by reducing pressure on the median nerve. Gabapentin and local steroid injections can also be used for carpal tunnel syndrome, while carpal tunnel release surgery is reserved for more severe cases. However, splinting is the best initial treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest Carpal Tunnel Syndrome (CTS). Initially, non-surgical management like splinting is the best treatment. Gabapentin and steroid injections are not the first-line treatments, and surgery should only be considered when non-surgical management fails.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest carpal tunnel syndrome, which is caused by compression of the median nerve in the wrist. Splinting can help to alleviate the symptoms in the initial stages. Gabapentin and local steroid injections are options for more severe cases, while carpal tunnel release surgery is considered as a last resort.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest carpal tunnel syndrome. The best initial treatment is splinting to immobilize the wrist and prevent pressure on the median nerve. Gabapentin and local steroid injections may be used if splinting is ineffective, and carpal tunnel release surgery is considered only after more conservative measures fail.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest carpal tunnel syndrome, and the best initial treatment is splinting to help alleviate the symptoms. Gabapentin and local steroid injections may be used in some cases, and carpal tunnel release surgery may be considered if symptoms persist or worsen.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and physical examination suggest carpal tunnel syndrome, which is often caused by repetitive use of the hands such as typing. Splinting can help reduce symptoms by immobilizing the affected wrist and decreasing pressure on the median nerve. The other options may be used for more severe cases or if conservative measures fail.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the physical examination suggest carpal tunnel syndrome. Splinting can help alleviate symptoms in mild to moderate cases. Gabapentin is used to treat neuropathic pain, but it is not the initial treatment for carpal tunnel syndrome. Local steroid injections and carpal tunnel release surgery are options for more severe cases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest carpal tunnel syndrome, especially since it appears after long days of typing and can wake the patient up from sleep. Splinting can reduce pressure on the median nerve and is a conservative initial treatment option. Gabapentin and local steroid injections can be used if conservative measures fail, while carpal tunnel release surgery is a more invasive option.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with pain and numbness in both hands, which suggests carpal tunnel syndrome. The best initial treatment is splinting to keep the wrist in a neutral position and reduce pressure on the median nerve. Gabapentin and local steroid injections may be used for more severe cases or if initial treatment fails, and carpal tunnel release surgery is an option for refractory cases or if there is evidence of nerve damage.
